intro: Gaultheria platyphylla, commonly known as the myrtle leaf wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant produces red berries that are edible and have a sharp, peppery flavor. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Gaultheria platyphylla is also valued for its aromatic leaves and is used in traditional Chinese medicine.
